results.abstract: Beekeeping on an industrial scale is central to American agriculture, and “colony collapse” has proved to be a severe test.

media.copyright: Kendrick Brinson for The New York Times
media.caption: Bret Adee’s family operation provides more than two billion bees to farmers who need to pollinate their crops. Before the hives are moved to the California almond groves where they are used in January and February, they are kept on a cattle ranch at a safe distance from pesticide and herbicide sprays.

results.adx_keywords: Bees;Adee Honey Farms;Adee, Bret;Environmental Protection Agency;California;Agriculture and Farming;Environment
results.title: A Bee Mogul Confronts the Crisis in His Field
